Welcome to pyhkp’s documentation!¶

Contents:

pyhkp module¶

This module provides a class to interact with OpenPGP keyservers using HKP.

class pyhkp.HKP(host, port=11371)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Class to interact with keyservers using the OpenPGP HTTP Keyserver Protocol (HKP), as defined in RFC draft-shaw-openpgp-hkp-00.

static lookup_pubkey_algorithm(alg)[source]¶

Lookup public key algorithm string for given algorithm id.

Parameters:alg (int) – algorithm id as defined in RFC 4880
Returns:algorithm name
Return type:str
retrieve(key_id, options=(None, ))[source]¶

Retrieve a public key from the keyserver by a given key id. Retrieval by query is not supported, since queries may be ambiguous.

Parameters:
  • key_id (str) – key id to get key from
  • options (tuple(str)) – nonstandard option starting with ‘x-‘ (see RFC draft)
Returns:

pgp public key, or None if not available/error
Return type:

str or None
search(query, operation='index', exact='off', options=(None, ), other_variables=(None, ))[source]¶

Search on a keyserver with given query. Query can be a key id or a string.

Structure of returned dict:

[{
  primary_key: {
      'key_id': str,
      'algorithm_id': int,
      'algorithm': str,
      'key_length': int,
      'creation': datetime or None,
      'expiration': datetime or None,
      'revoked': bool,
      'expired': bool,
      'disabled': bool},
  user_ids: [
      {
          'user_id': str,
          'creation': datetime or None,
          'expiration': datetime or None,
          'revoked': bool,
          'disabled': bool,
          'expired': bool
      },]
},]
Parameters:
  • query (str) – search string
  • operation (str) – operation is usually index, but can be nonstandard, starting with ‘x-‘
  • exact (str) – if on, the keyserver will search for an exact match for the contents of the ‘query’ variable
  • options (tuple(str)) – non-standard options starting with ‘x-‘
  • other_variables (tuple of tuple of strings) – other instructions, must start with ‘x-‘
Returns:

dict containing the values described above
Return type:

dict
submit(keys, options=(None, ))[source]¶

Submit one or more keys to the keyserver.

Parameters:
  • keys (str) – key(s) to submit
  • options (tuple(str)) –

    ‘nm’ or nonstandard option starting with ‘x-‘ (see RFC draft)
Returns:

http status code
Return type:

int
